title: Definitions
context: [ยง353G-2] Definitions. As used in this chapter unless the context requires otherwise: &ldquo;Assessment&rdquo; means an ongoing process through which a substance abuse professional collaborates with a client and other persons to gather and interpret information necessary for planning treatment and evaluating the client&rsquo;s progress. &ldquo;Assessment program&rdquo; refers to a not-for-profit corporation, government agency, or other entity accredited by the department of health to provide substance abuse services, or to a substance abuse professional certified pursuant to section 321-193. &ldquo;Drug or alcohol dependent&rdquo; means in a state of physical or psychological dependence, or both, arising from the use of a controlled substance or alcohol on a continuous basis that is characterized by behavioral and other responses, including but not limited to a strong compulsion to take the controlled substance or alcohol on a recurring basis, regardless of consequence, in order to experience its psychotropic effects or to avoid the discomfort of its absence. &ldquo;Repeat offender&rdquo; means any inmate in a state correctional center or facility who meets the requirements of section 353G-3(a). &ldquo;Substance abuse or additional treatment&rdquo; means any type of drug or alcohol treatment ordered by the department of public safety, the Hawaii paroling authority, or the agency responsible for monitoring a person&rsquo;s compliance with the terms and conditions of parole or other release from a correctional center or facility to address a person&rsquo;s drug or alcohol dependence or other substance abuse or addiction treatment. &ldquo;Substance abuse program&rdquo; or &ldquo;treatment program&rdquo; means a program concerned with education, prevention, or treatment directed toward achieving the prevention of substance abuse, or the social, mental, and physical restoration of substance abusers. The term &ldquo;program&rdquo; is synonymous with facility, agency, unit, and organization. &ldquo;Test&rdquo; or &ldquo;drug test&rdquo; means a test conducted in a medically safe and appropriate manner to determine the presence or absence of alcohol or controlled substance metabolites, or to determine the recent or historical use of alcohol or a controlled substance by the subject of the test.
